title: 2012 Soil Health Info Day: "Biology of Soil Compaction" with Jim Hoorman Ohio State University

tasks.task: Discuss soil compaction biology and management
subtasks: Explain the role of soil composition in compaction
Compare bulk densities of undisturbed vs. cultivated soils
Describe the effect of compaction on root penetration and crop yields
Explain the role of soil organic matter in reducing compaction
Describe methods to measure and assess soil compaction
Discuss the impact of heavy rainfall and equipment on soil compaction
Explain the benefits of cover crops and no-till practices in combating compaction
Describe the relationship between soil compaction and water infiltration rates
Outline the role of biological components (roots, microorganisms) in structure improvement
Discuss the impact of tillage on soil organic matter and compaction
Explain the concept of residue cover and its benefits
Mention the effects of different crop rotations on soil compaction
Suggest strategies for managing compaction (e.g., cover crops, subsoiling, strip tillage)
Highlight the importance of continuous vs. intermittent no-till farming
Discuss the role of erythrocytes (cover crops) in reducing compaction
Mention considerations for establishing cover crops (time, diversity, planting techniques)
Present the concept of ecological farming with year-round living plants
